instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00687: What is 820-00687? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting
threads.message:
board came with missing, <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>. replaced it and i get 20v 144ma on charger. CPU heats up but no CPU vcore
resistance on vcore is 8ohm (phase 1 &2). CPU dead?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting
threads.message:
8 ohm is not short.
If board was messed up before by someone else, could be a nightmare.
A simple knocked off component can cause the problem.
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> boards are known for CPU problems, could be wasting time...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting
threads.message:
unfortunately for me customer is paying alot for data, i will have to even replace CPU if needed.
i dug alittle further, found that vcore power was not enabled by <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.
and possible for you to help check if <RESISTOR>R7861</RESISTOR> is supposed to be no stuff or i'm indeed missing a resister there

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R7861</RESISTOR> is needed as pull-up resistor for power good signal from CPU core rail.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting
threads.message: yeap. boards ben sabotage, replaced <RESISTOR>R7861</RESISTOR> and now board now boots up but with question mark folder

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting
threads.message:
SSD failure is classic for these boards too.
Check if other component has been intentionally removed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting
threads.message:
no other component that i can find that are missing related to SSD.
when you say Classic SSD failure, the NAND itself fail?
i see alot videos with same symptoms but they do a CPU reball instead and SSD is back.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting
threads.message:
Could be caused by CPU, or SSD controller.
People on Internet claim they reballed both...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting
threads.message:
sorry for ranting but WTF??? board came from a customer who previously passed to a shop who says can't be fix and needed board replacement.
she needed data but sabotaging the board for business? i'll make sure this shop is properly backlisted and known to all local shops and customers to stay away. they pulled 2 resisters  <RESISTOR>R9376</RESISTOR> for Nand control and <RESISTOR>R7861</RESISTOR> for Vcore enable. 

thx much for the assistance

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting
threads.message:
You are a lucky man.
Go and buy lottery ticket...
